akn:section.akn:heading: Member’s power to dissociate; wrongful dissociation.

akn:content.akn:p: A person may dissociate as a member at any time, rightfully or wrongfully, by withdrawing as a member by express will under § 29-806.02(1).
A person’s dissociation from a limited liability company shall be wrongful only if the dissociation:

A person that wrongfully dissociates as a member shall be liable to the limited liability company and, subject to § 29-808.01, to the other members for damages caused by the dissociation. The liability shall be in addition to any other debt, obligation, or other liability of the member to the company or the other members.
